pr_title: Create TabletFile for use in TabletMetadata. Closes #1396

timeline.bodyText:
Not complete sure, but I think unless a

this will not show up as its own paragraph in the rendered javadoc.
timeline.author: keith-turner
timeline.diffHunk:

+package org.apache.accumulo.core.metadata.schema;
+
+import java.util.Objects;
+
+import org.apache.accumulo.core.Constants;
+import org.apache.accumulo.core.data.TableId;
+import org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path;
+import org.apache.hadoop.io.Text;
+
+/**
+ * Object representing a tablet file entry in the metadata table. Keeps a string of the exact entry
+ * of what is in the metadata table for the column qualifier of the
+ * {@link org.apache.accumulo.core.metadata.schema.MetadataSchema.TabletsSection.DataFileColumnFamily}
+ *
+ * As of 2.1, Tablet file paths should now be only absolute URIs with the removal of relative paths

timeline.author: keith-turner

replies.bodyText: I like this a lot better.  I can then drop TabletFileUtil, since this was the last thing it was doing.
replies.author: milleruntime

timeline.bodyText: Do you know if Hadoop's path object normalizes?
timeline.author: keith-turner

replies.bodyText: It does, which I tested with my previous recent change to Upgrader9to10Test.
replies.author: milleruntime

replies.bodyText: I can attest to that. I had the same question on an earlier PR, and Mike and I tested all sorts of combinations together as a sanity check to be sure that it does... at least with the minimum Hadoop version we're specifying in our pom.xml.
replies.author: ctubbsii

timeline.bodyText: Would be nice to also verify normalization.
timeline.author: keith-turner

replies.bodyText: I will add more tests with your ideas.  I thought I had a normalize test but I was thinking of the recent one I added for the upgrade code here.
replies.author: milleruntime

timeline.bodyText:
The following are some additional bad paths that would be nice to check.
hdfs://localhost:8020/accumulo/tablets/2a/default_tablet/F0000070.rf
hdfs://localhost:8020/accumulo/2a/default_tablet/F0000070.rf
/accumulo/tables/2a/default_tablet/F0000070.rf
hdfs://localhost:8020/accumulo/tables/2a/F0000070.rf
hdfs://localhost:8020/accumulo/tables/F0000070.rf
timeline.author: keith-turner

replies.bodyText: I just tested these and noticed we need more validation on the volume.  Since we are traversing backwards up from the filename, anything before "tables" will be a valid volume.  Any ideas?  The best I can come up with is what I've seen... valid if path.contains(":")
replies.author: milleruntime

replies.bodyText: Maybe ensure that volumePath.toUri().getScheme() is not null.
replies.author: keith-turner

timeline.message:
Created TabletFile for use in TabletMetadata

* Created new TabletFile object as a strong type to replace where
strings are used to reference metadata tablet file paths
* Drop parts of code dealing with relative paths
* TabletData only uses TabletFile to create a FileRef for now, follow on
work can be done to utilize TabletFile in place of FileRef
* Update tests to use absolute paths
* Add new Translator for TabletFile
Fixes to volume and updates to test

timeline.bodyText: There is a lot of string concatenation (which causes object allocation) for error messages that will usually never be seen in this method.
timeline.author: keith-turner

replies.bodyText: Good point.  I think I'd rather make one generic error message that includes the metadataEntry than trying to describe the part of the string which had an error.
replies.author: milleruntime

timeline.bodyText: Would also be nice to verify that TabletFile.equals and TabletFile.hashCode work as expected for normalized paths.
timeline.author: keith-turner

timeline.message: More fixes to TabletFile and test
